course.subject: MECH
course.name: Finite Element Methods
course.description: Finite element formulation; variational principles for structural and continuum mechanics; numerical interpolation and integration; plane stress and plane strain analysis; plate bending and three dimensional solids; solution of large systems of algebraic equations.
course.exclusions: AESF 5930, CIVL 5390, MESF 5930

reviews.author: donlee
reviews.comment_content:
starting with basic concept of numerical method, e.g. finite difference method to finite element method.

The contents are basically similar to the one for UG students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
her teaching style is good. Clear english and explanations.
She seems to be an experienced person in this field. If you try hard and willing to learn, there might be many tings to get out of.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is made based on several assignments, mid-term and final project.
I did just as much as average for the assignments, quite well for the mid term. (have no idea about the final project) and I got A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Things that are taught after mid-term is quite difficult but fortunately there is no final exam. Workload is not heavy.
